List records

Source: R/ora_list_records.R
ora_list_records.Rd

List records

Usage

ora_list_records(
  base_url = "https://ora.ox.ac.uk/oai2",
  metadata_prefix = c("oai_dc", "datacite_dc", "dart_dc", "solo_dc", "base_dc",
    "oai_openaire", "uketd_dc", "rioxx_terms", "rioxx_terms_cc0")
)

ora_list_records_id(
  base_url = "https://ora.ox.ac.uk/oai2",
  metadata_prefix = c("oai_dc", "datacite_dc", "dart_dc", "solo_dc", "base_dc",
    "oai_openaire", "uketd_dc", "rioxx_terms", "rioxx_terms_cc0")
)

Arguments

base_url

The OAI-PMH endpoint base URL. Set to https://ora.ox.ac.uk/oai2

metadata_prefix

Prefix or code for metadata format to retrieve for each record returned. List of all the metadata formats supported can be retrieved through a call to ora_list_metadata_formats(). Default is "oai_dc" for the OAI-PMH standard Dublin Core (DC).

Value

XML OAI response

Metadata Format

Metadata for each item (record) is available in several formats. Not all formats are supported for all records.

Examples

ora_list_records()
#> {xml_document}
#> <OAI-PMH schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/OAI-PMH.xsd" xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
#> [1] <responseDate>2026-02-01T22:08:08Z</responseDate>
#> [2] <request metadataPrefix="oai_dc" verb="ListRecords">https://ora.ox.ac.uk/ ...
#> [3] <ListRecords>\n  <record>\n    <header>\n      <identifier>oai:ora.ox.ac. ...
ora_list_records_id()
#> {xml_document}
#> <OAI-PMH schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/OAI-PMH.xsd" xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
#> [1] <responseDate>2026-02-01T22:08:11Z</responseDate>
#> [2] <request metadataPrefix="oai_dc" verb="ListIdentifiers">https://ora.ox.ac ...
#> [3] <ListIdentifiers>\n  <header>\n    <identifier>oai:ora.ox.ac.uk:uuid:0000 ...
